Sentencas: Serial sectioning by FIB/SEM and 3D reconstruction was used to study the microstructure-performance correlations for La0.8Sr0.2MnO3-delta (LSM) and 8 mol% yttria-stabilized ZrO2 (YSZ) solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) composite cathodes.
Titulo: Microstructural Optimization by Tailoring Particle Sizes for LSM-YSZ Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Composite Cathodes

Sentencas: In this study, the starting LSM and YSZ particle sizes were varied, keeping overall weight fractions of each solid phase constant.
Titulo: Microstructural Optimization by Tailoring Particle Sizes for LSM-YSZ Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Composite Cathodes

Sentencas: This analysis revealed a near one-to-one correlation between the specific parameters of the microstructure (such as the volumetric density of electrochemically-active triple phase boundaries) and cathode resistance (1/R-p).
Titulo: Microstructural Optimization by Tailoring Particle Sizes for LSM-YSZ Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Composite Cathodes

Sentencas: This study has also quantitatively demonstrated that for coarser particle size and larger particle-size disparity, lower TPB lengths and surface area densities lead to lower performance.
Titulo: Microstructural Optimization by Tailoring Particle Sizes for LSM-YSZ Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Composite Cathodes

Sentencas: The implications for design of optimal SOFC composite electrode microstructure are discussed.
Titulo: Microstructural Optimization by Tailoring Particle Sizes for LSM-YSZ Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Composite Cathodes
Microstructural Optimization by Tailoring Particle Sizes for LSM-YSZ Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Composite Cathodes
